intro: Adenandra fryi, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Adenandra fryi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in coastal environments.
